location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 274 of 1851 from Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at a camp near Bushire to Commodore John P Porter, Commander of the Indian Naval Squadron in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter conveys the Resident's agreement with the Commodore's decision to remove the squadron from Bahrain to the Persian Coast, as a result of an outbreak of cholera among the crew. It further reports that the squadron's goal has been met; it notes that Ameer Fysul has given up his hostile intentions against Bahrain.It further explains that the Bahrain and Kenn boats apparently seized by each side will be investigated by the Resident, but that no immediate action is required by the squadron.
